actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: A joint resolution expressing the sense of Congress that the States have the authority to require counseling before an abortion is performed and to require the signatures of two or more physicians on statements of approval before an abortion may be legally performed.
subjects: Abortion, Birth Control, and Family Planning

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that the States have the power to prohibit abortion unless: (1) the person involved receives medical counseling; and (2) two physicians have certified that the abortion is medically necessary to preserve such person's health.

titles.title: A joint resolution expressing the sense of Congress that the States have the authority to require counseling before an abortion is performed and to require the signatures of two or more physicians on statements of approval before an abortion may be legally performed.
